00063 PRIVATE void spectrum_thread( void )
00064 {
00065     while ( top->running )
00066     {
00067         sem_wait( top->sync.pws.sem );
00068         sem_wait( top->sync.upd.sem );
00069 
00070         if ( fwrite
00071              ( ( char * ) &uni->spec.label, sizeof( int ), 1,
00072                top->meas.spec.fp ) != 1 )
00073         {
00074             fprintf( stderr, "error writing spectrum label\n" );
00075             exit( 1 );
00076         }
00077 
00078         // spec points or waveform?
00079         if ( uni->spec.last == SPEC_LAST_FREQ )
00080         {
00081             compute_spectrum( &uni->spec );
00082             if ( fwrite
00083                  ( ( char * ) uni->spec.output, sizeof( float ),
00084                    uni->spec.size, top->meas.spec.fp ) != uni->spec.size )
00085             {
00086                 fprintf( stderr, "error writing spectrum\n" );
00087                 exit( 1 );
00088             }
00089 
00090         }
00091         else
00092         {
00093             if ( fwrite
00094                  ( ( char * ) uni->spec.oscope, sizeof( float ),
00095                    uni->spec.size, top->meas.spec.fp ) != uni->spec.size )
00096             {
00097                 fprintf( stderr, "error writing oscope\n" );
00098                 exit( 1 );
00099             }
00100         }
00101 
00102         fflush( top->meas.spec.fp );
00103         sem_post( top->sync.upd.sem );
00104     }
00105 
00106     pthread_exit( 0 );
00107 }

00109 PRIVATE void meter_thread( void )
00110 {
00111     while ( top->running )
00112     {
00113         sem_wait( top->sync.mtr.sem );
00114         sem_wait( top->sync.upd.sem );
00115 
00116         if ( fwrite
00117              ( ( char * ) &uni->meter.label, sizeof( int ), 1,
00118                top->meas.mtr.fp ) != 1 )
00119         {
00120             fprintf( stderr, "error writing meter label\n" );
00121             exit( 1 );
00122         }
00123 
00124         // RX or TX?
00125         if ( uni->meter.last == METER_LAST_RX )
00126         {
00127             if ( fwrite
00128                  ( ( char * ) uni->meter.snap.rx, sizeof( REAL ),
00129                    MAXRX * RXMETERPTS,
00130                    top->meas.mtr.fp ) != MAXRX * RXMETERPTS )
00131             {
00132                 fprintf( stderr, "error writing rx meter\n" );
00133                 exit( 1 );
00134             }
00135         }
00136         else
00137         {
00138             if ( fwrite
00139                  ( ( char * ) uni->meter.snap.tx, sizeof( REAL ), TXMETERPTS,
00140                    top->meas.mtr.fp ) != TXMETERPTS )
00141             {
00142                 fprintf( stderr, "error writing tx meter\n" );
00143                 exit( 1 );
00144             }
00145         }
00146 
00147         fflush( top->meas.mtr.fp );
00148         sem_post( top->sync.upd.sem );
00149     }
00150 
00151     pthread_exit( 0 );
00152 }

00156 PRIVATE void monitor_thread( void )
00157 {
00158     while ( top->running )
00159     {
00160         sem_wait( top->sync.mon.sem );
00161 
00162         // If there is anything that needs monitoring, do it here
00163         fprintf( top->snds.blow.fp,
00164                  "@@@ mon [%s %d]: rbi = %d rbo = %d xr = %d\n",
00165                  top->snds.name, uni->tick, top->snds.blow.rb.i,
00166                  top->snds.blow.rb.o, top->snds.blow.xr );
00167         fflush( top->snds.blow.fp );
00168         top->snds.blow.rb.i = top->snds.blow.rb.o = top->snds.blow.xr = 0;
00169     }
00170 
00171     pthread_exit( 0 );
00172 }

00176 PRIVATE void process_updates_thread( void )
00177 {
00178     while ( top->running )
00179     {
00180         pthread_testcancel(  );
00181 
00182         while ( fgets
00183                 ( top->parm.buff, sizeof( top->parm.buff ), top->parm.fp ) )
00184             do_update( top->parm.buff, top->verbose ? top->echo.fp : 0 );
00185     }
00186 
00187     pthread_exit( 0 );
00188 }

00192 PRIVATE void gethold( void )
00193 {
00194     if ( ( ringb_float_write_space( top->snds.ring.o.l ) <
00195            top->hold.size.frames ) ||
00196          ( ringb_float_write_space( top->snds.ring.o.r ) <
00197            top->hold.size.frames ) )
00198     {
00199         // pathology
00200         top->snds.blow.rb.o++;
00201     }
00202     else
00203     {
00204         ringb_float_write( top->snds.ring.o.l, top->hold.buf.l,
00205                            top->hold.size.frames );
00206         ringb_float_write( top->snds.ring.o.r, top->hold.buf.r,
00207                            top->hold.size.frames );
00208     }
00209 
00210     if ( ( ringb_float_read_space( top->snds.ring.i.l ) <
00211            top->hold.size.frames ) ||
00212          ( ringb_float_read_space( top->snds.ring.i.r ) <
00213            top->hold.size.frames ) )
00214     {
00215         // pathology
00216         memset( ( char * ) top->hold.buf.l, 0, top->hold.size.bytes );
00217         memset( ( char * ) top->hold.buf.r, 0, top->hold.size.bytes );
00218         top->snds.blow.rb.i++;
00219     }
00220     else
00221     {
00222         ringb_float_read( top->snds.ring.i.l, top->hold.buf.l,
00223                           top->hold.size.frames );
00224         ringb_float_read( top->snds.ring.i.r, top->hold.buf.r,
00225                           top->hold.size.frames );
00226     }
00227 }
00228 
00229 PRIVATE BOOLEAN canhold( void )
00230 {
00231     return ( ringb_float_read_space( top->snds.ring.i.l ) >=
00232              top->hold.size.frames ) &&
00233         ( ringb_float_read_space( top->snds.ring.i.r ) >=
00234           top->hold.size.frames );
00235 }

00239 PRIVATE void run_mute( void )
00240 {
00241     memset( ( char * ) top->hold.buf.l, 0, top->hold.size.bytes );
00242     memset( ( char * ) top->hold.buf.r, 0, top->hold.size.bytes );
00243     uni->tick++;
00244 }
00245 
00246 PRIVATE void run_pass( void )
00247 {
00248     uni->tick++;
00249 }
00250 
00251 PRIVATE void run_play( void )
00252 {
00253     process_samples( top->hold.buf.l, top->hold.buf.r,
00254                      top->hold.size.frames );
00255 }

00257 // NB do not set RUN_SWCH directly via setRunState;
00258 // use setSWCH instead
00259 
00260 PRIVATE void run_swch( void )
00261 {
00262     int i,
00263         n = top->hold.size.frames;
00264     REAL w;
00265 
00266     process_samples( top->hold.buf.l, top->hold.buf.r,
00267                      top->hold.size.frames );
00268 
00269     for ( i = 0; i < n; i++ )
00270     {
00271 
00272         if ( top->swch.env.curr.type == SWCH_FALL )
00273         {
00274             top->swch.env.curr.val += top->swch.env.fall.incr;
00275             w = sin( top->swch.env.curr.val * M_PI / 2.0 );
00276             top->hold.buf.l[i] *= w, top->hold.buf.r[i] *= w;
00277 
00278             if ( ++top->swch.env.curr.cnt >= top->swch.env.fall.size )
00279             {
00280                 top->swch.env.curr.type = SWCH_STDY;
00281                 top->swch.env.curr.cnt = 0;
00282                 top->swch.env.curr.val = 0.0;
00283             }
00284 
00285         }
00286         else if ( top->swch.env.curr.type == SWCH_STDY )
00287         {
00288             top->hold.buf.l[i] = top->hold.buf.r[i] = 0.0;
00289 
00290             if ( ++top->swch.env.curr.cnt >= top->swch.env.stdy.size )
00291             {
00292                 top->swch.env.curr.type = SWCH_RISE;
00293                 top->swch.env.curr.cnt = 0;
00294                 top->swch.env.curr.val = 0.0;
00295             }
00296 
00297         }
00298         else if ( top->swch.env.curr.type == SWCH_RISE )
00299         {
00300             top->swch.env.curr.val += top->swch.env.rise.incr;
00301             w = sin( top->swch.env.curr.val * M_PI / 2.0 );
00302             top->hold.buf.l[i] *= w, top->hold.buf.r[i] *= w;
00303 
00304             if ( ++top->swch.env.curr.cnt >= top->swch.env.rise.size )
00305             {
00306                 uni->mode.trx = top->swch.trx.next;
00307                 top->state = top->swch.run.last;
00308                 break;
00309             }
00310         }
00311     }
00312 }

00316 PRIVATE void audio_callback( jack_nframes_t nframes, void *arg )
00317 {
00318     float *lp,
00319          *rp;
00320     int nbytes = nframes * sizeof( float );
00321 
00322     if ( top->snds.doin )
00323     {
00324         int i;
00325         const float zero = 0.0;
00326         size_t rsiz = max( top->snds.rsiz, nframes );
00327 
00328         ringb_float_reset( top->snds.ring.i.l );
00329         ringb_float_reset( top->snds.ring.i.r );
00330 
00331         for ( i = top->offs; i < 0; i++ )
00332             ringb_float_write( top->snds.ring.i.l, &zero, 1 );
00333 
00334         for ( i = 0; i < top->offs; i++ )
00335             ringb_float_write( top->snds.ring.i.r, &zero, 1 );
00336 
00337         ringb_float_restart( top->snds.ring.o.r, rsiz );
00338         ringb_float_restart( top->snds.ring.o.l, rsiz );
00339 
00340         top->snds.doin = FALSE;
00341     }
00342 
00343     if ( top->susp )
00344     {
00345         lp = ( float * ) jack_port_get_buffer( top->snds.port.o.l, nframes );
00346         rp = ( float * ) jack_port_get_buffer( top->snds.port.o.r, nframes );
00347         memset( ( char * ) lp, 0, nbytes );
00348         memset( ( char * ) rp, 0, nbytes );
00349         return;
00350     }
00351 
00352     // output: copy from ring to port
00353 
00354     lp = ( float * ) jack_port_get_buffer( top->snds.port.o.l, nframes );
00355     rp = ( float * ) jack_port_get_buffer( top->snds.port.o.r, nframes );
00356 
00357     if ( ringb_float_read_space( top->snds.ring.o.l ) >= nframes )
00358     {
00359         ringb_float_read( top->snds.ring.o.l, lp, nframes );
00360         ringb_float_read( top->snds.ring.o.r, rp, nframes );
00361     }
00362     else
00363     {
00364         memset( ( char * ) lp, 0, nbytes );
00365         memset( ( char * ) rp, 0, nbytes );
00366         ringb_float_reset( top->snds.ring.o.l );
00367         ringb_float_reset( top->snds.ring.o.r );
00368         ringb_float_clear( top->snds.ring.o.l, nframes );
00369         ringb_float_clear( top->snds.ring.o.r, nframes );
00370         top->snds.blow.rb.o++;
00371     }
00372 
00373     // input: copy from port to ring
00374     if ( ringb_float_write_space( top->snds.ring.i.l ) >= nframes )
00375     {
00376         lp = ( float * ) jack_port_get_buffer( top->snds.port.i.l, nframes );
00377         rp = ( float * ) jack_port_get_buffer( top->snds.port.i.r, nframes );
00378         ringb_float_write( top->snds.ring.i.l, lp, nframes );
00379         ringb_float_write( top->snds.ring.i.r, rp, nframes );
00380     }
00381     else
00382     {
00383         top->snds.doin = TRUE;
00384         top->snds.blow.rb.i++;
00385     }
00386 
00387     // if enough accumulated in ring, fire dsp
00388     if ( ( ringb_float_read_space( top->snds.ring.i.l ) >=
00389            top->hold.size.frames ) &&
00390          ( ringb_float_read_space( top->snds.ring.i.r ) >=
00391            top->hold.size.frames ) )
00392         sem_post( top->sync.buf.sem );
00393 
00394     // check for blowups
00395     if ( ( top->snds.blow.rb.i > 0 ) || ( top->snds.blow.rb.o > 0 ) )
00396         sem_post( top->sync.mon.sem );
00397 }

00399 //========================================================================
00400 
00401 PRIVATE void process_samples_thread( void )
00402 {
00403     while ( top->running )
00404     {
00405         sem_wait( top->sync.buf.sem );
00406         do
00407         {
00408             gethold(  );
00409             sem_wait( top->sync.upd.sem );
00410             switch ( top->state )
00411             {
00412             case RUN_MUTE:
00413                 run_mute(  );
00414                 break;
00415             case RUN_PASS:
00416                 run_pass(  );
00417                 break;
00418             case RUN_PLAY:
00419                 run_play(  );
00420                 break;
00421             case RUN_SWCH:
00422                 run_swch(  );
00423                 break;
00424             }
00425             sem_post( top->sync.upd.sem );
00426         }
00427         while ( canhold(  ) );
00428     }
00429 }
00430 
00431 //========================================================================
00432 
00433 PRIVATE void execute( void )
00434 {
00435     // let updates run
00436     sem_post( top->sync.upd.sem );
00437 
00438     // rcfile
00439     {
00440         FILE *frc = find_rcfile( loc.path.rcfile );
00441 
00442         if ( frc )
00443         {
00444             while ( fgets( top->parm.buff, sizeof( top->parm.buff ), frc ) )
00445                 do_update( top->parm.buff, top->echo.fp ? stderr : 0 );
00446             fclose( frc );
00447         }
00448     }
00449 
00450     // start audio processing
00451     if ( jack_activate( top->snds.client ) )
00452         fprintf( stderr, "cannot activate jack client" ), exit( 1 );
00453 
00454     // final shutdown always starts in update thread,
00455     // so join it first
00456     pthread_join( top->thrd.upd.id, 0 );
00457 
00458     // issue cancellation notices
00459     pthread_cancel( top->thrd.trx.id );
00460     pthread_cancel( top->thrd.mon.id );
00461     if ( uni->meter.flag )
00462         pthread_cancel( top->thrd.mtr.id );
00463     if ( uni->spec.flag )
00464         pthread_cancel( top->thrd.pws.id );
00465 
00466     // wait for remaining threads to finish
00467     pthread_join( top->thrd.trx.id, 0 );
00468     pthread_join( top->thrd.mon.id, 0 );
00469     if ( uni->meter.flag )
00470         pthread_join( top->thrd.mtr.id, 0 );
00471     if ( uni->spec.flag )
00472         pthread_join( top->thrd.pws.id, 0 );
00473 
00474     // stop audio processing
00475     jack_client_close( top->snds.client );
00476 }

00480 PRIVATE void setup_local_audio( void )
00481 {
00482     top->offs = loc.skew.offs;
00483     top->hold.size.frames = uni->buflen;
00484     top->hold.size.bytes = top->hold.size.frames * sizeof( float );
00485     top->hold.buf.l =
00486         ( float * ) safealloc( top->hold.size.frames, sizeof( float ),
00487                                "main hold buffer left" );
00488     top->hold.buf.r =
00489         ( float * ) safealloc( top->hold.size.frames, sizeof( float ),
00490                                "main hold buffer right" );
00491 }
00492 
00493 PRIVATE void setup_updates( void )
00494 {
00495     top->parm.path = loc.path.parm;
00496     if ( ( top->parm.fd = open( top->parm.path, O_RDWR ) ) == -1 )
00497         perror( top->parm.path ), exit( 1 );
00498     if ( !( top->parm.fp = fdopen( top->parm.fd, "r+" ) ) )
00499     {
00500         fprintf( stderr, "can't fdopen parm pipe %s\n", loc.path.parm );
00501         exit( 1 );
00502     }
00503 
00504     // do this here 'cuz the update thread is controlling the action
00505     if ( uni->meter.flag )
00506     {
00507         top->meas.mtr.path = loc.path.meter;
00508         top->meas.mtr.fp = efopen( top->meas.mtr.path, "r+" );
00509     }
00510     if ( uni->spec.flag )
00511     {
00512         top->meas.spec.path = loc.path.spec;
00513         top->meas.spec.fp = efopen( top->meas.spec.path, "r+" );
00514     }
00515 
00516     if ( uni->update.path = loc.path.replay )
00517     {
00518         uni->update.flag = TRUE;
00519         uni->update.fp = efopen( uni->update.path, "w+" );
00520     }
00521 
00522     if ( top->verbose )
00523     {
00524         if ( loc.path.echo[0] )
00525         {
00526             top->echo.path = loc.path.echo;
00527             if ( ( top->echo.fd = open( top->echo.path, O_RDWR ) ) == -1 )
00528                 perror( top->echo.path ), exit( 1 );
00529             if ( !( top->echo.fp = fdopen( top->echo.fd, "r+" ) ) )
00530             {
00531                 fprintf( stderr, "can't fdopen echo file %s\n",
00532                          loc.path.echo );
00533                 exit( 1 );
00534             }
00535         }
00536         else
00537         {
00538             top->echo.path = 0;
00539             top->echo.fp = stderr;
00540             top->echo.fd = fileno( top->echo.fp );
00541         }
00542     }
00543 
00544     if ( loc.path.blowr[0] )
00545     {
00546         top->snds.blow.path = loc.path.blowr;
00547         if ( ( top->snds.blow.fd =
00548                open( top->snds.blow.path, O_RDWR ) ) == -1 )
00549             perror( top->snds.blow.path ), exit( 1 );
00550         if ( !( top->snds.blow.fp = fdopen( top->snds.blow.fd, "r+" ) ) )
00551         {
00552             fprintf( stderr, "can't fdopen blowr file %s\n", loc.path.blowr );
00553             exit( 1 );
00554         }
00555     }
00556     else
00557     {
00558         top->snds.blow.path = 0;
00559         top->snds.blow.fp = stderr;
00560         top->snds.blow.fd = fileno( top->snds.blow.fp );
00561     }
00562 }
00563 
00564 PRIVATE void jack_xrun( void *arg )
00565 {
00566     top->snds.blow.xr++;
00567     sem_post( top->sync.mon.sem );
00568 }

00570 PRIVATE void jack_shutdown( void *arg )
00571 {
00572 }

00574 PRIVATE void setup_system_audio( void )
00575 {
00576     top->snds.blow.rb.i = top->snds.blow.rb.o = top->snds.blow.xr = 0;
00577 
00578     if ( loc.name[0] )
00579         strcpy( top->snds.name, loc.name );
00580     else
00581         sprintf( top->snds.name, "sdr-%d", top->pid );
00582     if ( !( top->snds.client = jack_client_new( top->snds.name ) ) )
00583         perror( "can't make client -- jack not running?" ), exit( 1 );
00584 
00585     jack_set_process_callback( top->snds.client, ( void * ) audio_callback,
00586                                0 );
00587     jack_on_shutdown( top->snds.client, ( void * ) jack_shutdown, 0 );
00588     jack_set_xrun_callback( top->snds.client, ( void * ) jack_xrun, 0 );
00589     top->snds.size = jack_get_buffer_size( top->snds.client );
00590 
00591     top->snds.port.i.l =
00592         jack_port_register( top->snds.client, "il", JACK_DEFAULT_AUDIO_TYPE,
00593                             JackPortIsInput, 0 );
00594     top->snds.port.i.r =
00595         jack_port_register( top->snds.client, "ir", JACK_DEFAULT_AUDIO_TYPE,
00596                             JackPortIsInput, 0 );
00597     top->snds.port.o.l =
00598         jack_port_register( top->snds.client, "ol", JACK_DEFAULT_AUDIO_TYPE,
00599                             JackPortIsOutput, 0 );
00600     top->snds.port.o.r =
00601         jack_port_register( top->snds.client, "or", JACK_DEFAULT_AUDIO_TYPE,
00602                             JackPortIsOutput, 0 );
00603 
00604     top->snds.ring.i.l = ringb_float_create( top->snds.size * loc.mult.ring );
00605     top->snds.ring.i.r = ringb_float_create( top->snds.size * loc.mult.ring );
00606     top->snds.ring.o.l = ringb_float_create( top->snds.size * loc.mult.ring );
00607     top->snds.ring.o.r = ringb_float_create( top->snds.size * loc.mult.ring );
00608 
00609     top->snds.doin = TRUE;
00610 }
00611 
00612 PRIVATE sem_t *make_sem( char *id )
00613 {
00614     static char path[MAXPATHLEN];
00615     sem_t *s;
00616 
00617     sprintf( path, "%s.%d", id, top->pid );
00618     sem_unlink( path );
00619     if ( ( s =
00620            sem_open( path, O_CREAT | O_EXCL, 0600, 0 ) ) == ( sem_t * ) - 1 )
00621     {
00622         fprintf( stderr, "Failed to open semaphore %s\n", path );
00623         exit( 1 );
00624     }
00625     sem_unlink( path );
00626     return s;
00627 }
00628 
00629 PRIVATE void setup_threading( void )
00630 {
00631     top->sync.upd.sem = make_sem( "update" );
00632     pthread_create( &top->thrd.upd.id, 0, ( void * ) process_updates_thread,
00633                     0 );
00634 
00635     top->sync.buf.sem = make_sem( "buffer" );
00636     pthread_create( &top->thrd.trx.id, 0, ( void * ) process_samples_thread,
00637                     0 );
00638 
00639     top->sync.mon.sem = make_sem( "monitor" );
00640     pthread_create( &top->thrd.mon.id, 0, ( void * ) monitor_thread, 0 );
00641 
00642     top->susp = FALSE;
00643 
00644     if ( uni->meter.flag )
00645     {
00646         top->sync.mtr.sem = make_sem( "meter" );
00647         pthread_create( &top->thrd.mtr.id, 0, ( void * ) meter_thread, 0 );
00648     }
00649 
00650     if ( uni->spec.flag )
00651     {
00652         top->sync.pws.sem = make_sem( "spectrum" );
00653         pthread_create( &top->thrd.pws.id, 0, ( void * ) spectrum_thread, 0 );
00654     }
00655 }
00656 
00657 //========================================================================
00658 // hard defaults, then environment
00659 
00661 PRIVATE void setup_defaults( void )
00662 {
00663     // no env vars for these
00664     loc.name[0] = 0;            // no default for client name, period
00665     loc.path.blowr[0] = 0;      // file defaults to stderr
00666     loc.path.echo[0] = 0;       // file defaults to stderr
00667 
00668     strcpy( loc.path.meter, METERPATH );
00669     strcpy( loc.path.parm, PARMPATH );
00670     strcpy( loc.path.rcfile, RCBASE );
00671     strcpy( loc.path.replay, REPLAYPATH );
00672     strcpy( loc.path.spec, SPECPATH );
00673     strcpy( loc.path.wisdom, WISDOMPATH );
00674 
00675     loc.def.comp = DEFCOMP;
00676     loc.def.mode = DEFMODE;
00677     loc.def.nrx = MAXRX;
00678     loc.def.rate = DEFRATE;
00679     loc.def.size = DEFSIZE;
00680     loc.def.spec = DEFSPEC;
00681     loc.mult.ring = RINGMULT;
00682     loc.skew.offs = DEFOFFS;
00683 
00684     {
00685         char *ep;
00686 
00687         if ( ( ep = getenv( "SDR_DEFMODE" ) ) )
00688             loc.def.mode = atoi( ep );
00689         if ( ( ep = getenv( "SDR_DEFRATE" ) ) )
00690             loc.def.rate = atof( ep );
00691         if ( ( ep = getenv( "SDR_DEFSIZE" ) ) )
00692             loc.def.size = atoi( ep );
00693         if ( ( ep = getenv( "SDR_RINGMULT" ) ) )
00694             loc.mult.ring = atoi( ep );
00695         if ( ( ep = getenv( "SDR_SKEWOFFS" ) ) )
00696             loc.skew.offs = atoi( ep );
00697         if ( ( ep = getenv( "SDR_BLOWRPATH" ) ) )
00698             strcpy( loc.path.blowr, ep );
00699         if ( ( ep = getenv( "SDR_METERPATH" ) ) )
00700             strcpy( loc.path.meter, ep );
00701         if ( ( ep = getenv( "SDR_NAME" ) ) )
00702             strcpy( loc.name, ep );
00703         if ( ( ep = getenv( "SDR_PARMPATH" ) ) )
00704             strcpy( loc.path.parm, ep );
00705         if ( ( ep = getenv( "SDR_RCBASE" ) ) )
00706             strcpy( loc.path.rcfile, ep );
00707         if ( ( ep = getenv( "SDR_REPLAYPATH" ) ) )
00708             strcpy( loc.path.replay, ep );
00709         if ( ( ep = getenv( "SDR_SPECPATH" ) ) )
00710             strcpy( loc.path.spec, ep );
00711         if ( ( ep = getenv( "SDR_WISDOMPATH" ) ) )
00712             strcpy( loc.path.wisdom, ep );
00713     }
00714 }
00715 
00716 //========================================================================
00717 
00718 int reset_for_buflen( int new_buflen )
00719 {
00720 
00721     // make sure new size is power of 2
00722     if ( popcnt( new_buflen ) != 1 )
00723         return -1;
00724 
00725     safefree( ( char * ) top->hold.buf.r );
00726     safefree( ( char * ) top->hold.buf.l );
00727 
00728     destroy_workspace(  );
00729 
00730     //  fprintf(stderr, "safemem %d\n", safememcurrcount());
00731     safememreset(  );
00732 
00733     setup_workspace( loc.def.rate, loc.def.size =
00734                      new_buflen, loc.def.mode, loc.path.wisdom, loc.def.spec,
00735                      loc.def.nrx, loc.def.size );
00736 
00737     setup_local_audio(  );
00738 
00739     reset_meters(  );
00740     reset_spectrum(  );
00741     reset_counters(  );
00742 
00743     return 0;
00744 }
00745 
00746 PRIVATE void destroy_globals( void )
00747 {
00748     int i;
00749 
00750     safefree( ( char * ) tx );
00751     for ( i = 0; i < MAXRX; i++ )
00752         safefree( ( char * ) rx[i] );
00753     safefree( ( char * ) uni );
00754     safefree( ( char * ) top );
00755 }
00756 
00757 PRIVATE void closeup( void )
00758 {
00759     ringb_float_free( top->snds.ring.o.r );
00760     ringb_float_free( top->snds.ring.o.l );
00761     ringb_float_free( top->snds.ring.i.r );
00762     ringb_float_free( top->snds.ring.i.l );
00763 
00764     safefree( ( char * ) top->hold.buf.r );
00765     safefree( ( char * ) top->hold.buf.l );
00766 
00767     fclose( top->parm.fp );
00768     if ( top->snds.blow.fp != stderr )
00769         fclose( top->snds.blow.fp );
00770     if ( top->verbose && top->echo.fp != stderr )
00771         fclose( top->echo.fp );
00772 
00773     sem_close( top->sync.buf.sem );
00774     sem_close( top->sync.mon.sem );
00775     sem_close( top->sync.upd.sem );
00776 
00777     if ( uni->meter.flag )
00778     {
00779         fclose( top->meas.mtr.fp );
00780         sem_close( top->sync.mtr.sem );
00781     }
00782 
00783     if ( uni->spec.flag )
00784     {
00785         fclose( top->meas.spec.fp );
00786         sem_close( top->sync.pws.sem );
00787     }
00788 
00789     if ( uni->update.flag )
00790         fclose( uni->update.fp );
00791 
00792     destroy_workspace(  );
00793 
00794     destroy_globals(  );
00795 
00796     //  fprintf(stderr, "safemem %d\n", safememcurrcount());
00797 
00798     exit( 0 );
00799 }
00800 
00801 //========================================================================
00802 // commandline processing
00803 
00804 PRIVATE struct option long_options[] = {
00805     {"verbose", no_argument, 0, 0},
00806     {"spectrum", no_argument, 0, 1},
00807     {"metering", no_argument, 0, 2},
00808     {"load", required_argument, 0, 3},
00809     {"mode", required_argument, 0, 4},
00810     {"buffsize", required_argument, 0, 5},
00811     {"ringmult", required_argument, 0, 6},
00812     {"blowr-path", required_argument, 0, 7},
00813     {"meter-path", required_argument, 0, 8},
00814     {"client-name", required_argument, 0, 9},
00815     {"command-path", required_argument, 0, 10},
00816     {"init-path", required_argument, 0, 11},
00817     {"replay-path", required_argument, 0, 12},
00818     {"spectrum-path", required_argument, 0, 13},
00819     {"wisdom-path", required_argument, 0, 14},
00820     {"echo-path", required_argument, 0, 15},
00821     {"skewoffs", required_argument, 0, 16},
00822     {"help", no_argument, 0, 99},
00823     {0, 0, 0, 0}
00824 };
00825 PRIVATE char *short_options = "vmsl:h?";
00826 PRIVATE int option_index;
00827 
00828 PRIVATE void usage( void );
00829 
00831 PRIVATE void setup_from_commandline( int argc, char **argv )
00832 {
00833     int c;
00834 
00835     while ( ( c =
00836               getopt_long( argc, argv, short_options, long_options,
00837                            &option_index ) ) != EOF )
00838     {
00839         switch ( c )
00840         {
00841         case 0:
00842         case 'v':
00843             top->verbose = TRUE;
00844             break;
00845 
00846         case 1:
00847         case 's':
00848             uni->spec.flag = TRUE;
00849             break;
00850 
00851         case 2:
00852         case 'm':
00853             uni->meter.flag = TRUE;
00854             break;
00855 
00856         case 3:
00857         case 'l':
00858             strcpy( loc.path.rcfile, optarg );
00859             break;
00860 
00861         case 4:
00862             loc.def.mode = atoi( optarg );
00863             break;
00864 
00865         case 5:
00866             loc.def.size = atoi( optarg );
00867             break;
00868 
00869         case 6:
00870             loc.mult.ring = atoi( optarg );
00871             break;
00872 
00873         case 7:
00874             strcpy( loc.path.blowr, optarg );
00875             break;
00876 
00877         case 8:
00878             strcpy( loc.path.meter, optarg );
00879             break;
00880 
00881         case 9:
00882             strcpy( loc.name, optarg );
00883             break;
00884 
00885         case 10:
00886             strcpy( loc.path.parm, optarg );
00887             break;
00888 
00889         case 11:
00890             strcpy( loc.path.rcfile, optarg );
00891             break;
00892 
00893         case 12:
00894             strcpy( loc.path.replay, optarg );
00895             break;
00896 
00897         case 13:
00898             strcpy( loc.path.spec, optarg );
00899             break;
00900 
00901         case 14:
00902             strcpy( loc.path.wisdom, optarg );
00903             break;
00904 
00905         case 15:
00906             strcpy( loc.path.echo, optarg );
00907             break;
00908 
00909         case 16:
00910             loc.skew.offs = atoi( optarg );
00911             break;
00912 
00913         case 99:
00914         case 'h':
00915         default:
00916             usage(  );
00917         }
00918     }
00919 }
00920 
00921 //========================================================================
00922 
00924 PRIVATE void create_globals( void )
00925 {
00926     int i;
00927     top =
00928         ( struct _top * ) safealloc( 1, sizeof( struct _top ), "top global" );
00929     uni =
00930         ( struct _uni * ) safealloc( 1, sizeof( struct _uni ), "uni global" );
00931     for ( i = 0; i < MAXRX; i++ )
00932         rx[i] =
00933             ( struct _rx * ) safealloc( 1, sizeof( struct _rx ),
00934                                         "rx global" );
00935     tx = ( struct _tx * ) safealloc( 1, sizeof( struct _tx ), "tx global" );
00936 }
00937 
00939 PRIVATE void setup( int argc, char **argv )
00940 {
00941     create_globals(  );
00942 
00943     top->pid = getpid(  );      /* process ID */
00944     top->uid = getuid(  );      /* group ID */
00945     top->start_tv = now_tv(  ); /* time */
00946     top->running = TRUE;        /* status */
00947     top->verbose = FALSE;
00948     top->state = RUN_PLAY;      /* state */
00949     top->offs = DEFOFFS;
00950     top->snds.doin = FALSE;
00951     top->snds.rsiz = DEFSIZE;
00952 
00953     //  fprintf(stderr, "safemem %d\n", safememcurrcount());
00954     safememreset(  );
00955 
00956     setup_defaults(  );
00957 
00958     setup_from_commandline( argc, argv );
00959 
00960     setup_workspace( loc.def.rate, loc.def.size, loc.def.mode,
00961                      loc.path.wisdom, loc.def.spec, loc.def.nrx,
00962                      loc.def.comp );
00963 
00964     setup_updates(  );
00965 
00966     setup_local_audio(  );
00967     setup_system_audio(  );
00968 
00969     setup_threading(  );
00970 
00971     reset_meters(  );
00972     reset_spectrum(  );
00973     reset_counters(  );
00974 }
00975 
00976 //========================================================================
00977 
00979 int main( int argc, char **argv )
00980 {
00981     setup( argc, argv ), execute(  ), closeup(  );
00982 }
00983 
00985 PRIVATE void usage( void )
00986 {
00987     fprintf( stderr, "--verbose\n" );
00988     fprintf( stderr, " -v\n" );
00989     fprintf( stderr, "  Turn on verbose mode (echo commands, etc.)\n" );
00990     fprintf( stderr, "--spectrum\n" );
00991     fprintf( stderr, " -s\n" );
00992     fprintf( stderr, "  Turn on spectrum computation\n" );
00993     fprintf( stderr, "--metering\n" );
00994     fprintf( stderr, " -m\n" );
00995     fprintf( stderr, "  Turn on meter computation\n" );
00996     fprintf( stderr, "--load=<load-file>\n" );
00997     fprintf( stderr, " -l <load-file>\n" );
00998     fprintf( stderr, "  Read update commands from <load-file> at startup\n" );
00999     fprintf( stderr, "--mode=<mode>\n" );
01000     fprintf( stderr, "  Start radio in mode <mode>\n" );
01001     fprintf( stderr, "--buffsize=<power-of-2>\n" );
01002     fprintf( stderr, "  Use <power-of-2> as DSP buffersize\n" );
01003     fprintf( stderr, "--ringmult=<num>\n" );
01004     fprintf( stderr, "  Use <num> * <buffsize> for ring buffer length\n" );
01005     fprintf( stderr, "--blowr-path=<path>\n" );
01006     fprintf( stderr,
01007              "  Write audio-subsystem error monitor output to <path>\n" );
01008     fprintf( stderr, "--meter-path=<pipe-path>\n" );
01009     fprintf( stderr,
01010              "  Use named pipe <pipe-path> as conduit for meter data\n" );
01011     fprintf( stderr, "--client-name=<your-preference>\n" );
01012     fprintf( stderr, "  Name the DttSP jack client anything you like\n" );
01013     fprintf( stderr, "--command-path=<pipe-path>\n" );
01014     fprintf( stderr,
01015              "  Use named pipe <pipe-path> as a conduit for update commands\n" );
01016     fprintf( stderr, "--init-path=<init-file>\n" );
01017     fprintf( stderr,
01018              "  Read update commands from <init-file> at startup. Like -l.\n" );
01019     fprintf( stderr, "--replay-path=<path>\n" );
01020     fprintf( stderr,
01021              "  Write/reread saved update commands to/from <path>\n" );
01022     fprintf( stderr, "--spectrum-path=<pipe-path>\n" );
01023     fprintf( stderr,
01024              "  Use named pipe <pipe-path> as conduit for spectrum data\n" );
01025     fprintf( stderr, "--wisdom-path=<path>\n" );
01026     fprintf( stderr, "  fftw3 wisdom is in <path>\n" );
01027     fprintf( stderr, "--echo-path=<path>\n" );
01028     fprintf( stderr, "  Write update command processor output to <path>\n" );
01029     fprintf( stderr, "--skewoffs=<+/-num>\n" );
01030     fprintf( stderr, "  Correct for audio channel skew by num\n" );
01031     fprintf( stderr, "--help\n" );
01032     fprintf( stderr, " -h\n" );
01033     fprintf( stderr, "  Write this message and exit.\n" );
01034 
01035     exit( 1 );
01036 }
